medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening sharp nonradiating right lower quadrant and suprapubic pain for more than 24 hours.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began a little more than 24 hours prior to presentation. Initially, the pain improved but then worsened. Patient also experienced difficulty urinating but was able to void in the ED. He noted decreased appetite and oral intake, along with loose bowel movements due to laxative use, as he initially thought he was constipated.
